answers.answer: Hello,This feeling of tingling sensations that you are having are called Paresthesia. Chronic paresthesia indicates a problem with the functioning of neurons.Are you a diabetic or do you take alcohol?Parasthesias are common in alcoholics and metabolic disorders like diabetes, hypothyroidism, and hypoparathyroidismThey can also be due to peripheral vascular disease, vitamin B12 deficiency or malnutrition.Get your blood sugar and thyroid hormones levels evaluated. You can take some vit B12 for some days and see if the tingling is gone or not.In case the symptoms persist then pls consult a neurologist as it can be due to some neurological disorder. Common disorders causing paraesthesias are transient ischemic attack, motor neurone disease, or autoimmune disorders like multiple sclerosis or lupus erythematosus. A diagnostic evaluation by a neurologist is necessary to rule these out.Treatment will depend on the diagnosis.Hope it helps.In case you need more information then pls post us.

thank you for your response.yes I use to drink heavy in my 20's and some in my 30's but not much anymore, being check right now for thyroid{no results yet} b12 is fine, I do get check every year for diabetes as my father  has it. I do have high blood presure and as well suffer from sleep apnea, I take two blood pressure pills and pantolox{spelling} for my acid reflux/gerds,as for the cpac machine I don't use the machine as I find mask too uncomfortable, waiting to see sleep specialist again about full face mask, justa had a  scope done for ucler, however these symptoms started way before the ulcer ones, the blurred or foggy vision comes and goes, as well I forget to mention about the foggy head that comes with it and what seems like pressure in the face, along checks, etc..though none of this really effects my daily life at this time...it seems to be causing stress trying to figure out what ya have...I will make appt. again and ask to be refered to a neurosurgen..thanks

question: Hi,I have been experiencing symptoms that the dr seems not to understand or come up with a possible diganois.for several months I have had tingling in my entire body, particularly the head, then the hands and legs and feet, also I am having vision problems and have had my eys checked several times and the only diagoinis was reading glasses , which have not elevated the problem, it comes and goes which is weird, it seems for about 7-8 hours a day I have these symptoms and the rest of the day it clears up to about 90% better, i have recently noticed a humming sound in my head/ears espically when in quite area, last week about three times I have broken out in a sweat and felt a bit under the weather when it happens, nothing this week yet, I am not having any headaches, no vomiting etc..just find these symptoms weird and bothersome. anyone else experincing this?thanks for your opionons.
title: vision problems, humming in head, tingling throughout body
